remarks: In a unitary ring a left invertible element is not a zero divisor. Generalization of ~ zerdivemp1 by Frederic Line.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 18-Apr-2010.)
statement:
zerdivempx.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
zerdivempx.2 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
zerdivempx.3 $e |- Z = ( GId ` G ) $.
zerdivempx.4 $e |- X = ran G $.
zerdivempx.5 $e |- U = ( GId ` H ) $.
zerdivemp1x $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ A e. X /\ E. a e. X ( a H A ) = U ) -> ( B e. X -> ( ( A H B ) = Z -> B = Z ) ) ) $.
$d A a $.
$d B a $.
$d H a $.
$d R a $.
$d X a $.
$d Z a $.
